TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant PERSON was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is the father of PERSON , who was born in DATE . PERSON was allegedly detained by the police on DATE and subsequently disappeared .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case are disputed by the parties and will be set out separately .

CARDINAL . The facts as presented by the applicant are set out in Section B below . The ORG 's submissions concerning the facts are summarised in Section C below . The documentary evidence submitted by the parties is summarised in Section D.

CARDINAL . The applicant is a retired civil servant . At the time of the events giving rise to the present application he and his family lived in ORG , where his son PERSON ran the wholesale grocery shop owned by the applicant . Prior to living in GPE the applicant and his family had lived in the nearby town of ORG , where he worked as a civil servant . In DATE the applicant and his family moved to ORG after an officer threatened his son . In DATE the applicant was detained for DATE and was subjected to ill - treatment during his detention . He was subsequently acquitted of the charges against him .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the applicant arrived at the shop and saw CARDINAL men escorting PERSON out of the shop . CARDINAL of the men was blonde , tall and beardless with an “ NORP - style haircut ” . The second man was thickset , of average height and with dark skin . The men were armed and carried walkietalkies .

CARDINAL . NORP The CARDINAL men told the applicant that they were police officers and that they were taking his son to police headquarters so that he could submit a bid for a contract to provide canteen services at police headquarters . The men also took with them a box of sugar and a kilo of tea . When the QUANTITY men told the applicant that they would return PERSON in TIME and PERSON confirmed this , the applicant decided not to intervene . The applicant saw PERSON being led to a car that contained CARDINAL other occupants . Neighbouring shop owners also witnessed the CARDINAL men taking PERSON with them .

CARDINAL . The same CARDINAL men had previously visited the shop , stating that they had come from the canteen , and had asked PERSON to go with them . When PERSON had refused to go , the CARDINAL men had sat in the shop for TIME and had made CARDINAL telephone calls , which PERSON said he did not understand as the men had spoken in code . PERSON had been worried about the incident when he had related it to the applicant that TIME .

CARDINAL . When PERSON did not return on TIME of DATE , the applicant thought that he had been detained in custody . The following day he applied to the governor 's office and also to the chief prosecutor 's office at ORG . He applied again to the same prosecutor on DATE and on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant applied once again to the governor 's office .
CARDINAL . The applicant received a reply to his petition of DATE from the prosecutor at ORG , who stated that his son 's name did not feature in the custody records .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was summoned before ORG in connection with his petitions . The statement and the complaint he made were filed under preliminary file number CARDINAL . In relation to his petition to the governor 's office , the applicant was told to contact the murder desk at ORG police headquarters . The applicant applied by letter to that authority but did not receive a response other than a request to identify a number of unidentified bodies found in the area .

CARDINAL . Finally , in his observations submitted to the ORG in reply to the ORG 's observations on the admissibility and merits of the case , the applicant referred to an article published in the newspaper PERSON on DATE giving details of a purported confession made by CARDINAL Mr PERSON , allegedly a former agent of the PERSON ( PERSON GPE – anti - terror intelligence branch of the gendarmerie ) , describing the abduction and subsequent killing of his son PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . The Government confirmed that the applicant had lodged a complaint with the prosecutor on DATE . In that complaint the applicant alleged that his son had been taken into custody by police officers and requested information concerning his son 's whereabouts .

CARDINAL . Upon receipt of the applicant 's complaint , the prosecutor examined the custody records of police headquarters and concluded that PERSON ORG had not been taken into custody . The prosecutor did not initiate an investigation , on the grounds that there were neither custody records showing that PERSON had been detained nor any other evidence of his having been kidnapped or been the victim of an unlawful act .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE a statement was taken from the applicant at the murder desk of GPE police headquarters . Following the taking of this statement , PERSON was registered as a missing person and an investigation was carried out throughout the country in order to find him .

CARDINAL . After the ORG had declared the application admissible , it requested the ORG to provide a copy of the full investigation file concerning PERSON disappearance , together with information as to whether any investigation had been opened into LOC alleged confession relating to the abduction and killing of the applicant 's son . In reply , the Government informed the ORG that no investigation had been initiated either into the disappearance of PERSON or into the alleged confession of Mr PERSON , as the allegations had been abstract and unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . The following information appears from the documents submitted by the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a petition to the governor 's office in ORG in which he stated that his son had been taken away DATE by CARDINAL plain - clothes police officers claiming to have come from the canteen of GPE police headquarters . The applicant also stated that he had not been provided with any information about his son 's whereabouts , despite the fact that he had applied to all the relevant authorities .

On DATE the applicant submitted a petition to the prosecutor at ORG in ORG in which he stated that his son had been detained by members of the security forces on DATE and that he had not heard anything from him since that date . He asked the prosecutor to inform him about his son 's fate and where he was being detained . According to a hand - written note added to this petition by the prosecutor on CARDINAL DATE , the name of the applicant 's son did not feature in the custody records .

CARDINAL . The name PERSON does not feature in the custody records of GPE police headquarters which were submitted to ORG after the application was declared admissible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the confession purportedly made by ORG was published in the newspaper PERSON . Mr PERSON was quoted as having stated that PERSON had been kidnapped by the GPE and that his head had been smashed with a hammer by a certain PERSON –also known as GPE – so that it would not be possible to identify the body .
